creator: tom.morin@expeditors.com
text:
I'm probably missing something obvious, but I've been unable to figure out how
to delete directories using a wildcard.

So instead of this (test1/2/3 are directories):

        <delete failonerror="false" includeEmptyDirs="true">
            <fileset dir="${basedir}/test1"/>
            <fileset dir="${basedir}/test2"/>
            <fileset dir="${basedir}/test3"/>
        </delete>

I want to do this (which currently does nothing):

        <delete failonerror="false" includeEmptyDirs="true">
            <fileset dir="${basedir}/test*"/>
        </delete>

creator: carej@us.ibm.com
text:
Wildcards are not valid as part of the dir attribute on a fileset.

Please re-read the manual and ask for help on the user list before opening bugs.
